programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Following the teams who work behind-the-scenes of Oxford Street's Christmas light switch on, plus police on patrol deal with problems, from illegal immigration to shoplifting

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a terraced house in Exeter, Devon, a building plot in Darlington, Co Durham, and a pub in south Wales before finding out who bought each one at auction and how they get on with the renovations

programme.title: Sister Rita to the Rescue
programme.desc: The nun tries to tackle loneliness by starting a Friendship Club for residents, however it does not get off to a good start. Plus, she helps one of the food bank regulars

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville explore whether the labels on what people buy always tell the full story

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh and attempt to find three bargain purchases which might earn them a profit at auction. Tim Wonnacott is the master of ceremonies as experts Jonathan Pratt and Caroline Hawley help the red and blue corners

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel helps a couple face some difficult decisions about their daughter's future treatment, and Heston struggles to keep things under control at the rehearsal

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a lottery winner is kidnapped and held to ransom, Blake uses his keen instincts and personal touch to sift through the suspects

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A newly engaged couple are joined by Jules Hudson on a house-hunting mission in south Worcestershire, looking to purchase their first joint home with a budget of £300,000

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: An investigation into the internet dating sites that might be posting people's pictures and profile on other sites, and how to get the best value for money out of a tank of petrol. Plus, Matt Allwright confronts another Rogue Trader

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: New series. A dramatised account of the key moments in the lives of Henry VIII's wives, combining drama with the presenter's own contemporary historical comment. In this episode, Lucy follows Catherine of Aragon through her emotional and physical struggles to give Henry the heir he so desperately needs to continue his dynasty. When Catherine finally gives birth to a baby girl, Henry's eye wanders to the ladies at court - first Mary Boleyn, and then to her sister, Anne

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker hosts the light-hearted quiz, with sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, wheelchair tennis star Jordanne Whiley, Olympic bronze medal-winning judoka Sally Conway and goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge

programme.title: Film 2016
programme.desc: DJ Edith Bowman, joined by critics Danny Leigh and Peter Bradshaw, present a look at Oliver Stone's latest film Snowden, The Birth of a Nation and Office Christmas Party

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Amanda Holden takes part in the popular genealogy documentary, in which famous faces trace their family trees. The actress and presenter looks into the rumoured French ancestry on her mother's side of the family, an investigation that leads to an extraordinary Napoleonic-era cross-Channel romance. But she doesn't stop there. The suicide of her maternal grandfather has always loomed large over her family - and when his story takes her to France once again, she is moved to discover how he helped others through a harrowing tragedy

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tension grows between Ronnie and Jack, while things go from bad to worse for Roxy, and as gossip spreads she confides in Phil - giving her a chance to reflect on her actions. Shakil tries to get Carmel out of the house tomorrow night so he and Bex can push forward with their plan, and Denise is given a confidence boost by her tutor, Jorgen

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin takes part in the popular genealogy documentary, in which famous faces trace their family trees. The wildlife presenter describes herself as `a mongrel' - the result of her parents' lineages on the Caribbean islands of Trinidad and Martinique. In Trinidad, she goes in search of the first of her maternal ancestors to arrive on the island from India. Liz then heads to Martinique, where her paternal ancestors are said to have owned plantations - and slaves. However, what she uncovers is more complicated than she could have imagined

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: Alan Sugar tasks the entrepreneurs to produce their own brand of gin, complete with an eye-catching bottle and a matching cocktail. With the final in sight, the candidates are all out to impress and they battle for the chance to be the last project manager. However, once they decide and half the teams head off to the distilleries, one lot get a little too much into the spirit of things - and when the hangover hits during the pitch, any hint of personality dries up. For the others, an argument leaves one hopeful with a bitter taste in their mouth. But who will be getting a free taxi ride home?

programme.desc: Rock-A-Bye Bivalve: SpongeBob and Patrick find an abandoned baby clam and decide to rear the child as their own. SpongeBob takes on the role of mother, while Patrick becomes the father

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores how the public's view of Roman Britain has changed over the decades, examining events from the initial invasion, through to the construction of Hadrian's Wall and the eventual collapse of the empire, drawing on the work of archaeologists and historians and using 50 years of BBC archive footage. With contributions from Charlotte Higgins, Adrian Goldsworthy, Neil Faulkner and Jo Quinn

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Icing on the Cake
programme.desc: Food writer and chef Nigel Slater explores the earliest origins of cake in Britain, including how Elizabethan cooks discovered egg whites as a raising agent. He uncovers the ancient rituals surrounding the baking and eating of sweet treats, and reveals how buns were once banned for being too risque for the general public. Nigel also examines the popularity of the cupcake, and meets bakers hoping to revolutionise the concept of the cake

programme.title: Ian Hislop Goes Off the Rails
programme.desc: The story behind the 1963 Beeching Report, commissioned under Harold Macmillan's government, which led to the closure of a third of Britain's rail network. With contributions from experts, campaigners, railwaymen and passengers, Private Eye editor Ian Hislop outlines the historical background to the proposals, along with the social and economic impact that followed their implementation

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits archaeological digs around the UK, starting with the west of Britain. Fiinds include the lost First World War training trenches on Salisbury Plain, and Britain's first double henge - discovered just down the road from Stonehenge

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: The Taff: The River That Made Wales
programme.desc: Writer and fisherman Will Millard tells the story of how the once-polluted waterway was brought back from the dead to become one of the best salmon and trout rivers in Wales. Will travels from the source high in the Brecon Beacons National Park to Merthyr Tydfil, where he discovers that the town's ironworks were once vital to the British Empire. Along the way he trains with a mountain rescue team facing a unique set of challenges, meets a group of busy conservationists and fishes for wild brown trout in the most unlikely location

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Explorer and naturalist Stewart McPherson travels to all the UK's Overseas Territories. His journey begins in Bermuda, in the Atlantic, where he finds ancient castles and a bird that had been thought extinct for more than 300 years. From here he sets out to the centre of the Indian Ocean, to the British Indian Ocean Territory, to find the world's biggest land invertebrate. Half a world away, he eventually reaches Pitcairn Island, lost in the vastness of the Pacific, to meet the descendants of the mutineers from the Bounty

programme.title: The Ipcress File
programme.desc: An intelligence agent investigating the kidnap and brainwashing of Britain's most renowned scientists unpicks a complex chain of connections and high-level intrigue, while detecting evidence of double-dealing and counter-espionage. Spy thriller based on Len Deighton's novel, starring Michael Caine, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Nigel Green

programme.title: The Highest Court in the Land: Justice Makers
programme.desc: Documentary in which four Justices of the Supreme Court, the UK's final court of appeal, talk about the nature of their work and how they make decisions. The programme explores how fair the rulings of the court's members - 10 men and one woman - are, and whether their feelings ever influence their judgements. In its first 14 months, cases included MPs' expenses, which resulted in the prosecution of David Chaytor, and amendments to the status of pre-nuptial agreements. Narrated by Aidan Gillett

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Explorer and naturalist Stewart McPherson travels to all the UK's Overseas Territories. His journey begins in Bermuda, in the Atlantic, where he finds ancient castles and a bird that had been thought extinct for more than 300 years. From here he sets out to the centre of the Indian Ocean, to the British Indian Ocean Territory, to find the world's biggest land invertebrate. Half a world away, he eventually reaches Pitcairn Island, lost in the vastness of the Pacific, to meet the descendants of the mutineers from the Bounty

programme.title: The Secret History of Our Streets
programme.desc: The story of Arnold Circus, east London, the centrepiece of a Victorian social experiment that changed Britain. A ring-shaped street lined with blocks of flats, this was the country's first council estate, which opened in 1896. The planning of the development - from its lack of pubs to the pattern of its brickwork - was calculated to convey an air of respectability, as previously the land had been a crime-ridden slum. Residents past and present, including Minnie Finkelstein, Joan Rose and Aubrey Goldsmith, discuss its fortunes over the years

programme.title: How to Build a Dinosaur
programme.desc: Dr Alice Roberts discovers how to put a dinosaur skeleton back together, complete with muscles, correct posture and, in some cases, the correct skin colour. The creatures died out 65 million years ago and full skeletons are rarely found

programme.title: The Highest Court in the Land: Justice Makers
programme.desc: Documentary in which four Justices of the Supreme Court, the UK's final court of appeal, talk about the nature of their work and how they make decisions. The programme explores how fair the rulings of the court's members - 10 men and one woman - are, and whether their feelings ever influence their judgements. In its first 14 months, cases included MPs' expenses, which resulted in the prosecution of David Chaytor, and amendments to the status of pre-nuptial agreements. Narrated by Aidan Gillett

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: New series. Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore describes how the Habsburgs transformed Vienna into a multi-national city of music, culture, art and ideas. Simon explores the Habsburgs' rise to power and discovers more about how Vienna marked Europe's front line in the struggle to defend both Christendom and the Catholic Church from revolutionaries who plotted to destroy them

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: The Secret Life of the Cat.
programme.desc: The programme investigates what cats really get up to when they leave the comfort of their owners' homes. In a ground-breaking experiment, 50 domestic cats from a village in Surrey are tagged with GPS collars and cameras to record their every movement as they hunt in gardens and patrol the fences and hedgerows

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Early Earth was a canvas for the vast new palette of the colours of life, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the colour of their skin in order to hide from the world

programme.title: Back in Time for Brixton
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Irwins experience life in the 1970's, '80s and '90s, discovering how a new generation of black Britons made their way through three decades of British history, guided by presenter Giles Coren and social historian Emma Dabiri. They meet former West Indies cricket captain Clive Lloyd and learn about the 1976 tour of England in which he led his side to victory, before reflecting on the Brixton Riots of the 1980s, and hosting a typical 1989-style party with DJ and producer Jazzie B of Soul II Soul

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates have to push their imagination and design skills to the limit to create their own virtual-reality games, before pitching them to enthusiasts and industry experts at the world-famous London Comic Con exhibition. One team opts for an undersea game, while the other reaches for the stars. However, one project manager loses patience when a giggling sub-team fails to take the task seriously enough. On pitch day, the reality of speaking to the largest audience in Apprentice history causes nerves to take hold. The audience then votes for their favourite game, and when the results are announced in the boardroom, it will be `game over' for at least one of the hopefuls

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows 10 more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is soap actor Danny Dyer, who wants to know more about his tough working-class family in the East End of London. He hopes his history will `freak a few people out' - but he gets more than he bargained for when he unearths an extraordinary lineage stretching back to the 11th century

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how John F Kennedy exploited the power of the photograph more than any other politician before him, but concealed two secrets that could potentially have brought down the Presidency. While he seemed to be exposing his whole life to the camera, the patriot with a glittering war record managed to keep his fragile state of health and his reputation for womanising hidden from the public

programme.title: Sister Rita to the Rescue
programme.desc: The nun finds herself thrust onto the national stage when the Lalley Centre is chosen to pilot a new government scheme, while a woman fighting the system needs assistance

programme.title: Flog It

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central region chefs fight it out for the fish course, where the dish of unusual cheese custard and a risotto made without rice catches the attention alongside the more traditional salmon, Cornish crab and lobster

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Anna Marie Humphreys wants to buy a special present for her sister Amanda, and enlists the help of Lorne Spicer and Paul Hayes to search the house she shares with her mother Theresa in north Wales for valuables to sell at auction

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team goes island-hopping around the Western Isles and out to Shetland. Nick Crane hunts for gannets on Eriskay, and Neil Oliver hears the tragic story of a 1918 shipwreck off the Isle of Lewis in which more than 200 servicemen returning from the First World War were drowned. Hermione Cockburn tests the acoustic qualities of Fingal's Cave on the uninhabited island of Staffa, and Miranda Krestovnikoff investigates a project to breed a super-strong Shetland pony

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Already preoccupied with the possibility that she might be pregnant, Penny also has to deal with the prospect of dinner with Vince's parents. After receiving the results of the test, both of the mismatched lovers claim to be pleased. Comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to Canada in the autumn to reunite with the Arctic wolves he has been following as they try to raise their pups and prepare for winter. The cameraman also walks with members of the pack as they hunt lemmings, musk oxen and hares and encounter a rival pack

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Jack heads out around town with Sarah on her first day at work, but the horrors of the war cast a shadow over Inverness. Meanwhile, Olivia is unable to stop herself from wondering about the woman James admitted to loving in Europe, and makes a shocking discovery. Drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp, Craig Hall, Arianwen Parkes-Lockwood and David Berry

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Will Axon v Paul Hayes Foreign Market.
programme.desc: Paul Hayes and Will Axon go head to head at a Parisian antiques market, where Will dips into the world of vintage wine and Paul pushes his personal boundaries by buying contemporary furniture

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize. Presented by Jeremy Vine

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing - It Takes Two
programme.desc: Zoe Ball presents the usual mid-week catch-up, and one of the couples joins her on the sofa. Plus, Ian Waite casts his eye over the couples' training footage for a preview of their forthcoming performances

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Casualty actresses Susan Cookson and Suzanne Packer are assisted by experts James Braxton and David Harper on a tour of the north west of England, before heading to Sheffield, where they meet a very special woman

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Judges Monica Galetti and Marcus Wareing challenge five of the remaining contestants to work together as a team to prepare a three-course menu for an event hosted by the president of the Royal Society of Medicine. Having got used to collaborating, the chefs are pitted against each other once more to prepare a showstopping dish in just 90 minutes

programme.title: The Big Life Fix with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: New series. A team of inventors try to help people in need, creating solutions to everyday problems, beginning with a terminally ill photographer who can no longer use his hands to operate a camera. They attempt to bring cutting-edge technology to a remote Welsh village which has no internet access and an unreliable telephone connection, and give some control back to a young designer who has Parkinson's disease and who has been unable to use a pen since developing tremors in her hands two years ago

programme.title: The Premier League Show
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents the magazine programme featuring news and action from the Premier League, plus interviews with the country's biggest football stars

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Choir: Gareth's Best in Britain
programme.desc: It's the semi-final, and the four groups Gareth Malone has picked from across the country are brought together for the first time at boot camp, before they go head-to-head to stay in the contest. They'll face intensive mentoring, from Gareth and top vocal and performance coaches, as part of a challenge designed to target and overcome their musical weaknesses. Eventually the jury's votes decide which group will go through to the Grand Final

programme.title: The Choir: Gareth's Best in Britain
programme.desc: It's the Grand Final of Gareth Malone's contest to find Britain's most entertaining, undiscovered, amateur choir. Three are left, and all that stands between them and the title of series champion is one last challenge, and that comes with a twist. While the loss of their leader poses a problem for one team, another group decamps to the country to focus all their energies on victory. The choirs have 10 days to perfect their performances before they compete one final time, in front of a 2000-strong crowd and a jury of musical experts, at London's Central Hall Westminster

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason meets the campaigners trying to improve the choice of deaf children's toys, and the deaf 12-year-old rapidly making a name for himself with his funny online videos

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar

programme.title: The Last Miners
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following the lives of workers at Kellingley colliery in North Yorkshire in the run-up to its closure, signalling the end of deep-coal mining in Britain. Shift manager Jonesy and his men are under pressure to cut enough coal to pay off the pit's debts, ensure their redundancy pay is safe and try to secure themselves a future beyond the mine. A number of mechanical breakdowns put them behind schedule, prompting assistant pit manager Pete to get his hands dirty and go down the mine to help sort things out. Christopher Eccleston narrates

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: The story of a photoshoot that captured the essence of American film star James Dean, whose enigmatic and troubled demeanour epitomised youthful angst. During an intimate collaboration in February 1955, just seven months before the actor's sudden death, Dennis Stock produced a series of revealing and enduring images, along with photographs that were so disturbing he refused to release them to the press

programme.title: Sister Rita to the Rescue
programme.desc: The nun tries to tackle loneliness by starting a Friendship Club for residents, however it does not get off to a good start. Plus, she helps one of the food bank regulars

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a `singing revolution'

programme.title: Just Good Friends

programme.title: Live Rugby Union
programme.sub-title: Live Rugby Union: Varsity Men's Match: Oxford v Cambridge.
programme.desc: Oxford v Cambridge (Kick-off 2.30pm). John Inverdale presents coverage of the 135th staging of the annual fixture between the rivals, held at Twickenham. Oxford their sixth successive triumph with a hard-fought 12-6 victory last year, despite the presence of Wales international Jamie Roberts in the Cambridge line-up. With commentary by Andrew Cotter and Damian Hopley

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah performs a spiritual cleansing in the local creek as a religious occasion approaches, but she's spotted by Doris Collins. She finds it hard to deal with the woman's reaction to her nudity, but it is her own personal demons that she is struggling with the most. Marta Dusseldorp and Deborah Kennedy star

programme.sub-title: Will Axon v Paul Hayes UK Antiques Fair.
programme.desc: Antiques experts Paul Hayes and Will Axon battle against the weather as they search for goods at an antiques fair in West Sussex. Will has a tricky start when the torrential rain closes his usual hunting ground, and Paul has mixed fortunes when hagglling hard for a bargain

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Chefs and The Incredible Spice Men co-presenters Tony Singh and Cyrus Todiwala join experts David Harper and Natasha Raskin on a quest to find items to sell at an auction in Rosewell, Midlothian. Setting off from Dundee, they travel down the east coast of Scotland, with Tony discovering why one Scottish city was home to many millionaires and Cyrus finding his sea legs as he learns why Anstruther was a pivotal fishing port in the 19th century

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the last programme of knockout week, the second group of five chefs face two tough tests. First they work together to cook a three-course fine dining menu at the French Ambassador's Residence. Teamwork will be key as they to plan, execute and transport their dishes to the table for five discerning guests - including the Ambassador's Chef de Cuisine. They then return to the MasterChef kitchen to produce a showstopper dish in just 90 minutes - hoping it will be enough to book their place in the semi-finals. As ever, deciding their fates will be no-nonsense judges Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti

programme.title: Close to the Enemy
programme.desc: Victor comes to Callum with proof that Dieter, who is seemingly helping the British to achieve their jet-engine goals, is not innocent of war crimes. Callum goes some way to regaining Victor and Kathy's favour by helping the latter get access to a useful German prisoner, Bergit Mentz. He also believes he can get the proof Harold requires to expose the British government's wartime secrets, while keeping Victor and Rachel close to him at the hotel. But can he really have it all? Stephen Poliakoff's period drama, starring Jim Sturgess, Freddie Highmore and Phoebe Fox
